definitions: Any of various solid or semisolid amorphous organic substances, often yellowish or brownish, exuded from trees or plants.

Any of a class of synthetic polymers that are viscous liquids or low melting-point solids at room temperature, becoming irreversible solids when heated, and are used in plastics, adhesives, and coatings.
examples: Synthetic resins are used in many industrial applications.
The artist worked with various resins to create the sculpture.
